question: Solubility Rules (Soluble)
answer: Sodium, potassium, ammonium, and nitrate salts are soluble; Salts with CH3COO- and ClO4- are soluble; All bromides, chorides, and iodides are soluble, except those with Pb2+, Ca2+, Sr2+, and Ba2+; All salts with SO42- are soluble, except those with Pb2+, Ca2+, Sr2+, and Ba2+

question: Solubility Rules (Insoluble)
answer: Compounds with CO32- and PO43- are insoluble, except those with group 1 and the ammonium ion; Most sulfides are insoluble, except those with group 1 and 2 and the ammonium ion; Most hydroxides are insoluble, except those with group 1, calcium, and barium; Most oxides are insoluble, except those with group 1 and 2
